ANU.name: Marwan El Hassan
interest: Marwan’s research interests include applying systems thinking from the fields of human ecology and resilience to address challenges around sustainability and complex human environmental issues.  Marwan is interested in developing systems-based conceptual frameworks and scenario models to explore the often-wicked problems that characterise social ecological systems and understand the dynamics and behaviour of these systems. Marwan is also interested in the idea of innovation platforms to establish partnerships and facilitate dialogue and collaboration towards a shared understanding and co-management of complex social ecological systems. He is keen to expand his understanding of the goat problem by applying other theories, particularly adaptive pathways and Theory of Change. Ultimately, Marwan would like the opportunity to scale the lessons learnt from studying the goat social ecological system to other similarly complex problems.

publication.source: Understanding general surveillance for biosecurity as a system
